item.title: We need a new vision for shared rivers in South Asia
item.description: The story of transboundary water sharing in South Asia is one of competing fears and intertwined destinies. The Yarlung Zangbo dam, the expiring Ganges treaty, the frozen Teesta deal, and the floundering Indus framework all point to a fragile regional order under hydrological stress.

item.title: How Bangladesh can use its geo-economic advantage to sustain development
item.description: Geo-economics is not just maps and borders; it is about understanding how geography turns into economic power, and how trade routes, coastlines, and neighbours shape what a country can become.
